intro: Gomphandra sawiensis, commonly known as the Malagasy gomphandra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and sumac. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
